name: event_id
description: a unique communication event id (PK), optional (mainly diagnostic / debugging / maintenance)
the type of event, is one of the following values: 'sent', 'bounce', 'open', 'click', ...
name: event_type

description: the category of event, is one of the following values: 'inbound', 'outbound', ...
name: event_category
datetime
description: the timestamp of the event

the id of the sending of the communication (unique per sending and per communication, but can have several events, like sent, open, click, the sending id must be generated by the channel as a unique identifier of each sent event...
name: sending_id

description: the system code which sent the message (e.g.: 'NEWSLETTER', 'E-SHOP', ...)
name: sending_sys_cd
channel_id
description: the id of the communication channel (optional)
the channel (name) of the communication: 'email', ...
name: channel_name
run_id
description: the id of the batch execution (can cover several sending ids) (optional)
a unique communication id should be unique per message sent to a specific person and should match the communication_id of the communication_planning table
name: communication_id

description: the id of the communication (unique per communication, but could be applied to many receipients, ...)
name: message_id
message_name
description: the name of the communication

name: thread_id
description: the id of the communication thread (should refer to a prior communication_id or message_id which is the root of the thread)

name: thread_type
description: the type of the communication thread (typically 'message' of 'communication', by default is is considered as a 'communication' thread)

name: thread_name
description: the name of the communication thread

name: campaign_id
description: the id of the campaign or communication group

name: campaign_name
description: the name of the campaign or communication group

name: external_id
description: an external id if provided by a separated system (for example, the request_id if provided by boxalino narrative response)

name: receiver_id
description: the persona_id as referenced in other tables

name: receiver_type
description: the type of persona (user, guest, ...)

name: receiver_title
description: use only if providing data in flat format (like CSV) if you skip the nested structure senders

name: receiver_firstname
description: use only if providing data in flat format (like CSV) if you skip the nested structure senders

name: receiver_lastname
description: use only if providing data in flat format (like CSV) if you skip the nested structure senders

name: receiver_email
description: the email address (can be null)
the visitor cookie ids from Boxalino of Google Analygtics (can be empty)
name: receiver_visitor_ids
